prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. This will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane for this part. Next, draw the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The loop for this sketch consists of four lines: * Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0]; End Point = [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0]; End Point = [0.75, 0.25] * Line 3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.25]; End Point = [0.0, 0.25] * Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.25]; End Point = [0.0, 0.0] With the 2D sketch complete, scale it using the sketch scale factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system (euler angles and translation vector). Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Use an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.375 and an extrude depth in the opposite direction of the normals of 0.0. This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 4 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. **Part 2: Rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.5, 0.0, 0.125]. This will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane for this part. Next, draw the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The loop for this sketch consists of four lines: * Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0]; End Point = [0.25, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point = [0.25, 0.0]; End Point = [0.25, 0.125] * Line 3: Start Point = [0.25, 0.125]; End Point = [0.0, 0.125] * Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.125]; End Point = [0.0, 0.0] With the 2D sketch complete, do not scale it. Instead, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system (euler angles and translation vector). Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Use an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.0 and an extrude depth in the opposite direction of the normals of 0.125. This will result in a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units by 2 units by 1 unit.</description>
